text: just look at these people waiting they
come every day hoping there's going to
be a food distribution just the faces
they tell the story of your movement of
people thousands of people living under
siege for months upon months without
access to enough food or medical
well this is the result of the siege
that was imposed and that prevailed here
for so long complete destruction we have
walked from the border of the area till
this place and we have hardly seen
anything any shop or any living
accommodation in any kind of good order
so there will be a lot of work to do but
it is it is good that we are here today
it is good that we can start doing what
the Security Council resolution has
stipulated must be done by the parties
which is to allow humanitarian agencies
under in this particular case other
agencies in other parts of Syria deliver
desperately needed humanitarian
assistance I've been speaking to the
people here they've been deprived of
everything for too long and it is not a
day too late that we are able to do this
extend all the way back here the women
in deciding on that song actually
desperate is Grecian on their faces a
woman just told me that she came today
because it is it is not so crowded
because we've had this a couple of times
before and there was a huge problem of
crowd control
